messageBody:
> So... it seems that there is really no need for J2ME Unit if one can
> test using JUnit and the KVM.
>
> Do you think that will work?
>

Unfortunately, no. That was the first thing we tried. J2ME doesn't support
certain features in Java that JUnit relies on. J2ME doesn't have reflection,
for instance, which is used heavily by J2MEUnit. J2MEUnit is basically just
a rewrite of JUnit's functionality, modified not to use those features of
Java that J2ME doesn't have.

I'd love to try what you talk about, with the KVM being called through ant.
It would be interesting if it would work. If it didn't, it would be a simple
job to write a new task for ant to make it work.
